pullRequest.body:
Define the notion of a divided power structure on an ideal of a ring.

Prove basic lemmas:
* the variant of the multinomial theorem in this context 
* a formula for products of divided powers

Co-authored with: [Mar√≠a In√©s de Frutos-Fern√°ndez](https://github.com/mariainesdff)

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11953352669/job/33321046821)

I think this is more easily done using `Nat.succ_mul_choose_eq`.
Indeed.

```suggestion
For `x y : A` and `m n : ‚Ñï` such that `x ‚àà I` and `y ‚àà I`, one has
```

```suggestion
* `DividedPowers.exp_add`: its multiplicativity
```

```suggestion
but several ideals of the same ring might be considered.
```

```suggestion
* `DividedPowers.dpow_comp` : `dpow m (dpow n x) = uniformBell m n * dpow (m * n) x`
```

```suggestion
```
For some reason, we thought that we had to provide `Inhabited` instance of the structure we had introduced. Of course, it is not so important.

Fortunately, the `CoeFun` instance create two absolutely identical syntaxes! 
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
theorem DividedPowers.coe_injective {A : Type*} [CommSemiring A] (I : Ideal A) :
```

It would be nice to have this lemma as `DividedPowers.ext`, which requires removing the `ext` attribute on the structure above, and some adjustements here:
```suggestion
@[ext]
theorem DividedPowers.ext {A : Type*} [CommSemiring A]
    {I : Ideal A} (hI : DividedPowers I) (hI' : DividedPowers I)
    (h_eq : ‚àÄ (n : ‚Ñï) {x : A} (_ : x ‚àà I), hI.dpow n x = hI'.dpow n x) :
    hI = hI' := by
  obtain ‚ü®hI, h‚ÇÄ, _‚ü© := hI
  obtain ‚ü®hI', h‚ÇÄ', _‚ü© := hI'
  simp only [mk.injEq]
  ext n x
  by_cases hx : x ‚àà I
  ¬∑ exact h_eq n hx
  ¬∑ rw [h‚ÇÄ hx, h‚ÇÄ' hx]
```
Then, `coe_injective` should also be moved after this lemma.

```suggestion
  simp only [exp, PowerSeries.coeff_mk, PowerSeries.coeff_mul, hI.dpow_add n ha hb]
```
Do you need this version?
I'd say yes, for future work, when you wish to get `dp_add` from the multiplicativity property of the exponential series only.

It seems `dpow_smul` would be better named `dpow_mul`, and `dpow_mul` could be named `mul_dpow` (or `dpow_mul_dpow`).

I would think that the phrase `smul` (and the notation `‚Ä¢`) should completely disappear from the API.
from the API of divided powers, or from mathlib?
in any case, I made the change
I am not as radical as suggesting removing `smul` from mathlib...
Do you insist that I delete it now? the point is that I don't have enough visibility of the adaptations it would need later on.
Better names could be `ofRingEquiv_dpow` and `ofRingEquiv_dpow_apply`.
This can be `simp` (maybe also the previous one).

```suggestion
satisfying relations that model the intuitive formula `dpow n a = a ^ n / n.!` and
```
This probably wouldn't work in Lean, but in the doc it looks nicer.

```suggestion
open Finset Nat Ideal
```
Then a lot of `Ideal.` can be removed.

```suggestion
structure DividedPowers {A : Type*} [Semiring A] (I : Ideal A) where
```
Because why not.

I wouldn't do that for a deep mathematical reason: people still do not know what the adequate definition of divided powers on a noncommutative ring should be. I learnt that from Serre who told me about Cartan. Indeed, divided powers were born in the noncommutative world of cohomology of varieties, but Cartan understands the definition only on the even part (which is commutative).
So, while it is likely that there is a usable/useful definition of divided powers on a noncommutative ring, I understand that we don't know what it is yet.
OK, no problem.

```suggestion
instance {A : Type*} [Semiring A] (I : Ideal A) :
    CoeFun (DividedPowers I) fun _ ‚Ü¶ ‚Ñï ‚Üí A ‚Üí A := ‚ü®fun hI => hI.dpow‚ü©
```

```suggestion

variable {A : Type*} [Semiring A] (I : Ideal A)

```
Then this can be removed in various declarations

```suggestion
theorem DividedPowers.ext {A : Type*} [Semiring A]
```
This is the same `open` line as in the previous section. You can just use it before sectioning.

```suggestion
variable {A : Type*} [Semiring A] {I : Ideal A}
```
This breaks things at some point, can you have a `Semiring` section with the results that work? I know this is stupid generality, so please don't spend any time in fixing proofs that break.

Also, adding `{a b : A}` to the variable line seems a good idea (in the very next lemma the two variables are `x` and `y`, but you can use the same `a` and `b` there and in various declarations).

```suggestion
def exp (hI : DividedPowers I) (a : A) : PowerSeries A :=
```
This is just stylistic, but I am becoming a big fan of specifying the types.

```suggestion
    (n ! : A) * hI.dpow n x = x ^ n := by
```
The space before the `!` is unfortunately needed.
Have you considered using `NeZero n` here? (not sure if it is a good idea).
The issue is that `zero_pow` uses `hn` as an argument and not `[NeZero n]`.

```suggestion
    (hI : DividedPowers I) {x} (hx : x ‚àà I) : x ^ n = 0 := by
```

```suggestion
  have h_fac : (n ! : A) * hI.dpow n x =
```
And in various other places.
Maybe `private`?
The lemma is there in hope that it will be useful elsewhere. Finding a better name would be more appropriate than `private`izing the definition.
I made this lemma slightly more general, renamed it as `dpow_sum'` and deleted the second one (which is now mathematically equivalent to the new one, but complicated to use, because of coercions.)

```suggestion
      (fun m _ ‚Ü¶ m.filterNe a)
```
And in various other places.
[Nat.multinomial](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Nat/Choose/Multinomial.html#Nat.multinomial) is in mathlib!

I don't remember what I meant. I added a note that this lemma should be golfable using the equivalence `Finset.symInsertEquiv`, but I didn't manage to do it (the issue is having to play with types, subtypes, conversion between finsets and fintypes, etc.).
I don't understand this comment.
me neither

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/DividedPowers/Basic): definition of divided powers
